content.description: This is the wide crack/chimney to the right of "Erotic City".
A poor quality grainy on the northeast side of the rock.

climbs.name: The Leg Lifter
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Tom Michael & Steve Strong, December 1989

content.description: This is the zig-zag route which is on the side of the buttress/face that has Erotic City.  Personally, I think this is the best route at this small crag.  The climbing is reachy, challenging, continuous, interesting, engaging, and exciting.  A few of the moves are powerful, and you have to hang in there.  The hardest moves may be at the start.  At the top, there is a move past a bolt that stumped Hidetaka Suzuki for a few moments;  he didn't get it his first try.  If you climb at this grade, this is a worthy climb.
content.protection: There are a few fixed things  (bolts, piton, and there used to be a fixed stopper near the top too;..I bet it's gone; it didn't seem too "fixed".) I think there is now an anchor on top, but not from the FA team.
content.location: On the right side of the Erotic Dome buttress.  The route is easily seen from the road, and not far from the road.

content.description: Start off the block on patina crimps and up the bolt line.  Recover under the roof, reach out and over on good holds and pull up.  Once established above the roof, make fun moves on the arete and grainy face to the top.
content.protection: 7 bolts + 2 anchor bolts.  The anchor is not rap equipped so whoever is last will need to walk off to the south or walk 15 feet and rap off the Leg Lifter anchor.

climbs.name: Erotic City
climbs.fa: Mike Paul, John Mallery & Mike Fogarty, December 1985

content.description:
The route starts as a relatively easy handcrack that ends after about 30'. At this point move right and continue in the thinner crack above through a steeper section to a ledgy topout.

The crux is the move to the right when the initial crack ends. It's a reachy and awkward face sequence, and is much harder than the rest of the route, which detracts a bit from the climb IMO. That said, it's still a worthy route.

Rap from either of the bolted anchors described in the comment below or walk off/downclimb either left or right. Having done the walkoff right, I recommend rapping.
This route must have been named by someone who hated offwidths.  It's actually quite a nice climb (but it is an offwidth).
content.protection: Two six inch pieces provide the main protection.
content.location: On the west face of the rock - you can't miss it.
